fr.xephi.authme.message

Class MessageFileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.message.MessageFileHandler

  • public class MessageFileHandler
extends Object
    Handles a YAML message file with a default file fallback.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageFileHandler(File file, String defaultFile, String updateCommand)
      Constructor.

      Returns the message for the given key.
      String getMessageIfExists(String key)
      Returns the message for the given key only if it exists, i.e.
      boolean hasSection(String path)
      Returns whether the message file configuration has an entry at the given path.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageFileHandler

        public MessageFileHandler(File file,
                          String defaultFile,
                          String updateCommand)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to use for messages
        defaultFile - the default file from the JAR to use if no message is found
        updateCommand - command to update the messages file (nullable) to show in error messages

    • Method Detail

      • hasSection

        public boolean hasSection(String path)
        Returns whether the message file configuration has an entry at the given path.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to verify
        Returns:
        true if an entry exists for the path in the messages file, false otherwise

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(String key)
        Returns the message for the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to retrieve the message for
        Returns:
        the message

      • getMessageIfExists

        public String getMessageIfExists(String key)
        Returns the message for the given key only if it exists, i.e. without falling back to the default file.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to retrieve the message for
        Returns:
        the message, or null if not available
